selected_quotes: Cumulative Head Impact Exposure Predicts Later-Life Mood Disorder Cognitive Impairment in Former Football Players htt…
Some recent academic work on CTE: on neuropathology: and on cognitive function repeat hits ht…
Repeated Hits to the Head More Significant Than #Concussion.
Cumulative head impacts may increase risk of neurological symptoms
Cumulative headimpact predict depression cogn impairment in HS college #football players

citation.abstract: Repetitive head impacts (RHI) refer to the cumulative exposure to concussive and subconcussive events. Although RHI is believed to increase risk for later-life neurological consequences (including chronic traumatic encephalopathy), quantitative analysis of this relationship has not yet been examined due to the lack of validated tools to quantify lifetime RHI exposure. The objectives of this study were: 1) to develop a metric to quantify cumulative RHI exposure from football, that we term the cumulative head impact index (CHII); 2) to use the CHII to examine the association between RHI exposure and long-term clinical outcomes; and (3) to evaluate its predictive properties relative to other exposure metrics (i.e., duration of play, age of first exposure, concussion history). Participants included 93 former high school and collegiate football players that completed objective cognitive and self-reported behavioral/mood tests as part of a larger ongoing longitudinal study. Using established cut-off scores, we transformed continuous outcomes into dichotomous variables (normal versus impaired). The CHII was computed for each participant and derived from a combination of self-reported athletic history (i.e., number of seasons, position(s), levels played), and impact frequencies reported in helmet accelerometer studies. A bivariate probit, instrumental variable model revealed a threshold dose-response relationship between the CHII and risk for later-life cognitive impairment (p<0.0019), self-reported executive dysfunction (p<0.0003), depression (p<0.0009), apathy (p<0.0040), and behavioral dysregulation (p<.0001). Ultimately, the CHII demonstrated greater predictive validity relative to other individual exposure metrics.
citation.title: Cumulative Head Impact Exposure Predicts Later-Life Depression, Apathy, Executive Dysfunction, and Cognitive Impairment in Former High School and College Football Players

news.title: Repeated hits to head bigger football threat than concussions
news.summary: BOSTON, April 1 (UPI) -- While repeated concussions pose a significant danger to football players, researchers at Boston University suggest in a new study that the overall number of impacts to the head is a much greater risk to players' future health.

author.description: 公式RTを乱発するのでご注意を。フォロー／アンフォローはお気軽に。但しフォロー返しという習慣はありません。好きなこと：音楽全般（梶浦由記／水樹奈々／茅原実里／坂本真綾／GARNiDELiA／織田かおり／Kalafina）／サッカー（町田ゼルビア、SC相模原など）／野球（埼玉西武ライオンズ） 時たま真面目な話もします。

author.name: ネコ
author.description: たわいもない事を呟いてます。好き：「ジャイアントコーン(グリコ産ではなくペルー産)」。嫌い：頭痛と肩凝り(じわっとくる痛みに極端に弱いです)。弱点：低い情報処理能力、卓越した誤判断能力、年々衰える記憶力（涙） http://twilog.org/neko_tubuyaki アイコン時々変わります。

facebook.title: Brain study focuses on repeated hits to head
facebook.summary: Study Focuses on Repeated Hits, Not Concussions for Risk.  A new study in the Journal of Neurotrauma found a correlation between the cumulative number of hits experienced by football players and their later-life clinical outcomes --  depression, cognition

facebook.title: Study Focuses on Repeated Hits, Not Concussions
facebook.summary: Cette étude ouvre une avenue originale qui est tout à fait juste: elle établit un lien entre les atteintes neurologiques non pas en relation avec les commotions cérébrales mais plutôt en lien avec le risque de traumatismes sous-commotionnels suivant la pos
